reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here. We have a 2 year old son, and he got such a kick out of the flamingos,ducks and koi fish on the property. The hotel could probably use some renovation/updating to parts, but it is still clean and nice. We were happy with a room and felt it was spacious. Its nice that the rooms have patios and balconies - we did not upgrade to the bay side, but that is probably even nicer! As a side note, if you are travelling near the 4th of July, it was a great place to watch fireworks from! We could see a great show neaer Gaslamp and the convention center. We found Coronado Island to be very charming and recommend staying here!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Coronado is great!

reviews.text: We recently spent 8 days there. Paid extra for a bay view room and it was worth it. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, as was the servers in the restaurant. they went out of their way to serve us without being annoying. The breakfast was fresh every day. The rooms need updating and the fridge is very small. the fitness center was great - very clean and good equipment. Overall it fit our needs and we would go back and stay there.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights for a wedding and various other parties on the premises and beyond and I have to say everything was perfect. This is most definitely a resort property. The lobby/bar is modern and cool and the rooms are spacious and the bathrooms were spa like and huge! The property is spread out so if you have a room at one end you may do some walking - I found that to be a plus actually. Room service was very good and I loved the pool area with the outdoor bar and plenty of chaise lounges. The fitness facility was well outfitted and clean and just upstairs from the spa services.
reviews.title: Loved it, didn't want to leave

reviews.text: The wedding was beautiful out on the lawn and the Marriott staff did a beautiful job with the reception and organizing the wedding party and accommodating the guests.
reviews.title: Very ordinary - and got ripped off on rate

reviews.text: We also appreciated the quietness of the property as opposed to the noise factor closer into the town area. Its easy enough to go there but so nice to come back to the resort. All in all, great memories were made and we would definitely return.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel Mother's Day weekend in May 2008. The hotel is in a good location on the island of Coronado, but it's on the San Diego side, not the Pacific side.
reviews.title: Good location but not a real resort

likes.disliked: — The lack of real resort qualities

reviews.text: We checked in very early in the day, so our room wasn't ready, but the staff cheerfully checked us in and directed us to the bellman to hold our luggage.
reviews.title: Not a resort and very expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we finally got into our room, it was a "lagoon view." Which was not so bad. The pond and trees hid the parking lot on the other side. It also appears that all rooms at this hotel have balconies which is nice. The hotel is only three stories tall, so don't expect any fabulous views. The room was very spacious, with a sitting area and a counter/vanity outside the bathroom. It appears the counter used to house a refrigerator and/or wet bar, but not anymore. You can tell the hotel has been renovated, but it still needs additional work.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The water taxi to downtown and blacony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very nice, but a separate soaking tub and shower and generous counter space.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with amazing views!

reviews.text: The hotel layout is confusing and we got lost a couple times trying to find the parking garage. It can be quite a walk to the elevator if you aren't close.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: Booked this hotel for 3 nights but loved it so we stayed for 6. Staff was wonderful. Had to pay for internet but everything was great. Loved the pools - room service and rooms are big!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel Staff was wonderful!!!

likes.disliked: — Had to pay $9.95 for internat daily

reviews.text: Fabulous hotel, very open and lush views. Loved the ducks walking down the interior open corridor with me, the fresh fruit infused water and dark chocolates in the lobby. Rooms enormous, although mine was constantly damp feeling.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, but a Pain for Conferences

likes.liked: — Beautiful surroundings in and around hotel

reviews.text: HOWEVER, it's a $15 taxi to the convention center and the water taxi only leaves every 30 min. I would stay here again in a heartbeat for vacation but not for a conference.
reviews.title: A wonderful place on Coronado

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott on Coronado Island for a week in May. We couldn't have enjoyed the stay more. I was there for business; my wife was on vacation!
reviews.title: Perfect weekend getaway

likes.liked: — The outdoor pool area and view of the city

reviews.text: The staff was always friendly and helpful. Our room had a bay view; the room was very comfortable and arranged very well. The bedroom had a king bed, sofa, dresser, work desk and flat screen TV. The bath has separate tub and shower and plenty of sink countertop space for all my wife's stuff. The balcony overlooking the bay was so pleasant that we never watched television. You can also request a minifridge and a microwave if you want to store cold drinks and/or make popcorn.
reviews.title: A slice of Heaven on Coronado Island!

likes.liked: — The quiet room. They are so hard to come by when staying away from home.
likes.disliked: — That I couldn't have stayed longer!

reviews.text: San Diego is beautiful. Coronado Island is beautiful. Marriott Coronado is beautiful, but it did not make out "Best of" list from our 8 day trip to the San Diego Area.
reviews.title: Stunningly beautiful, but.......

likes.disliked: — the price of a piece of paradise

reviews.text: We stayed there for 5 days.
reviews.title: Beautiful island

reviews.text: The view was amazing and we really loved staying there, but unfortunately we had to eat elsewhere. The wonderfully looking buffet was $19 for adults and $7 for kids. I could deal with that for one morning, but not 5.
reviews.title: Enjoyable and Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat any other meals there. There are many good places not too far away.
reviews.title: great getaway

likes.disliked: — had to pay $20 to self park, unless you wanted to park on the street

reviews.text: The pool was spectacular.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in a lot of Marriotts and this hotel is not worth the price.
reviews.title: Expected more from a Category 6 hotel

reviews.text: We had a bay view room, but the view was of a old rusty naval ship. Any city views were covered by tall palm trees on the property.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but not for conference goers

reviews.text: The hotel is very old and does not have a resort feeling as the name would suggest.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, but pricey

likes.disliked: — Over priced, unfriendly front desk staff

reviews.text: The rooms are musty and needed to be aired out for several hours.
reviews.title: okay stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is $20 a day, but plenty of self parking is available for free on the street.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

likes.disliked: — pay for internet access 9.95 a day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 4 nights at the Coronado Marriott and loved it. It was worth spending the extra money for the view of the bay. Truly enjoyed our time on the patio watching not only the activity in the courtyard and pool area but also the bay. Overall the service at the Marriot was good with one exception- we left our luggage with the bellhop on arrival and told that it would be brought up "shortly." After 30 minuites, my husband went down and wheeled the carrier to our room. He said that no one was at the desk?? The room and common areas were very clean. The location is in walking distance to the ferry landing where there are restaurants and shops. We rented our bikes at the ferry landing because the resort's price was higher. The resort is family oriented- be prepared to have children around the pool area. I would recommend that the jacuzzi be restricted to adults only. The restaurant was excellent with a great patio. We did not have a problem finding a parking place on the street nearby. The workout area was very nice- enjoyed the outdoor lap pool.
reviews.title: Great location and nice place
Over Priced & Dated
reviews.text: Reviews are not accurate, this Marriott is what a "resort" looked like 25+ years ago. I followed the suggestion of fellow reviewers and booked a exec suite but it did not help. The room was located at the North end of the resort far from lobby, pool area and restaurant. Our view was that if the apartment complex parking lot and barking dogs. The sofa was dirty so we ended up just sitting on the bed. We were so disappointed that we immediately changed our reservation to only one night and left the next day. Should have suspected that this hotel would not be to our liking when the front desk rep was raving about the Marriott Marquis on the Marina that we were planning to move to after our stay on Coronado. Well my advice is stay at the Marriott Marquis and take the water shuttle to Coronado for the day. Overall Coronado is way over rated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is so beautiful. It is situated directly on the pier/boardwalk so water activity, biking, jogging, or a romantic is easily accesible. The grounds are maintained expertly and the staff was very friendly. Pool is large are heated. Table tennis next to the pool bar. There were lots of families at the hotel. Seems many were running around without parental supervision which was irritating at times which isn't the hotels fault. Outside of the Poland table tennis there isn't a lot of activities for children. I was suggest the hotel for a romantic getaway or rest and relaxation. We will be back for sure.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Food very overpriced. Extra for any kind of view but if you dont upgrade you are staring at a building or a shrub buttingup to yoir pati. Parking is pricey check your bill they trief charging mr for three nigjts of vslrt at 28.00 per night and self park at 22.00 per night. Pool area nice and great view. Room and bath need a little upgrading. Csn walk to Ferry landing.
reviews.title: Nice hotelbut overpriced

reviews.text: We wanted to stay in Coronado while visiting San Diego and we are so glad we stayed at this resort! The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is so relaxing. Our room was spacious and clean on the 2nd floor, with a 'resort' view. If you pay for a resort view, you can't expect to have a breathtaking view of the city or the pool area. If you want that, then you need to pay extra to be on the pool/city view side of the resort. This resort has many, many comfortable seating areas scattered around the grounds so if you don't like the view from your room, you can find many places to sit, relax, and take in the beautiful San Diego weather and views! The breakfast buffet was delicious, but you can order off the menu, too. I recommend sitting outside in the patio dining area to enjoy the beautiful view of San Diego. There is a water taxi right by the resort, which costs only $6.00 to ride over to the Marriott across the bay and great walking paths all around the resort. We will definitely stay here on our next trip back to San Diego.
reviews.title: Peaceful Resort
Loved the Coronado Marriott Resort
reviews.text: We just returned from a seven-night stay at the Marriott Coronado Island resort and loved it! After staying at the Hotel Del last summer, we were a little worried we'd miss being right on the ocean. However, so many aspects of the Marriott were better than the Del that we will choose this hotel from now on. First, the pool area: having a child, the pool is a very important feature. The Marriott's pool had a true resort feel and had a beautiful view of the downtown San Diego skyline right across the bay. Second, the location. Though not on the beach, it is so easy to get to. We enjoyed being on the bayside and seeing the skyline, and loved the walking path. We walked to the ferry landing shops and to the great playground the other direction. Third, we felt the Marriott just had a more relaxed feel overall. The Del is hectic and busy all the time with non-guests who want to visit this historic hotel. Our room at the Marriott was great, service was great, self parking was easy and great. We can't wait to return, hopefully next summer!

The Marriott resort on Coronado Island is an excellent place to stay in San Diego. We had room 232, which offered a great view of the city skyline across the inlet. The rooms are very large. Our family of four had plenty of space. We had a couple of friends that live in San Diego come over to visit us, and our room had a decent size countertop / bar in the center of the room and a large balcony which, combined with the view, offered a nice place to have a few drinks before heading out for dinner. The parking is a little expensive. Self parking was good, though, because you could park close to the elevator and get to the hotel lobby without much walking. Their Gym is a decent size, and they offered free headphones to plug into the machines while watching TV (a nice touch). Their pool was very warm (almost too warm), but again, very nice. You will need to drive to the beach, but we found that parking easy as long as you head over in the morning. You may want to consider parking on the nearby streets to save some $. There were many non-metered spots closeby in the surrounding neighborhood. Water coolers were set up in the lobby every day with a different type of fruit in them for flavor. Our kids enjoyed checking in the morning to see what the water flavor of the day would be.
reviews.title: Great choice on Coronado Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While this is a beautiful resort and we had a wonderful view of the harbor and the bridge, I was disappointed in Marriott's nickel & dime-ing. I guess this goes for all Marriotts but for the price we paid per night you would think they could offer some free amenities or at least some breakfast. The water shuttle they mention on their site is actually $6/person each way, internet is $13/night (the "free" wireless internet they claim is only in the lobby), they even wanted to charge me a delivery fee to bring me a spoon from the kitchen (and no, they wouldn't just let me come get it). They also wouldn't let me take my own bags. Only the bellman could use the luggage carts (and of course, that means a tip). None of these fees are mentioned on the website. It got pretty ridiculous. We were splurging to celebrate our anniversary in a more expensive hotel and I left feeling like it wasn't really worth the extra money especially since we were out and about a lot. Unless you're planning on spending your entire stay in your room or at the resort (in which case, this hotel would be wonderful), find a cheaper hotel that offers some free amenities.
reviews.title: Disappointed in Marriott

reviews.text: This had not been my first choice hotel but after staying here I will never stay anywhere else in San Diego. While this is a 'resort" and I am sure some people never leave the grounds for their entire stay, it is very easy to get to San Diego using either the hotel water shuttle or the local ferry. (We walked from Amtrak station to ferry to hotel--no need for a rental car!) There are several good restaurant options within easy walking distance if you don't want to eat at the hotel. The grounds are lovely, complete with ducklings, fish and flamingos. Our room was good-sized and had a balcony which was a great place to sit and read the newspaper, etc. There are several pools and hot tubs, including a lap pool for more serious swimmers. The main pool overlooks the Bay and was a great place to watch fireworks after the ball game at Petco Park. The service was very attentive throughout.
reviews.title: First choice from now on!

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the breakfast buffet is VERY expensive even on weekdays--$50+ for two people is a lot.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the ground floor with a view looking directly onto the water. It was beautiful. A very nice paved path ran by the waters edge for perfect view of the water while walking for my morning exercise. There were many restaurants within walking distant of the hotel. The room was spacious and had a mini fridge. It was a little cool when we were there in June so I never got to use the pool, but it looked very nice. Again facing the water. I would definitely stay here again, just a different time of the year.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Coronado Marriott, the rooms are big and comfortable, the location is excellent, and you have a beautiful view of downtown San Diego. You can take the water taxi directly from the hotel every half hour and be in downtown San Diego in 10 minutes! You can rent bikes and there is a nice little trail that takes you to Il Fornaio restaurant and the shops right next door.
reviews.title: Great location, great view!

reviews.text: Our family really enjoyed staying at the Coronado Island Marriott. Genuine resort experience, but with a relaxing and unpretentious feel. All staff we interacted with very customer service-oriented. The location is perfect, looking across the harbor towards the downtown skyline, with the span of the Coronado Island Bridge in view. A pleasurable 5-minute walk along the harbor takes you to the Ferry Landing village of shops and restaurants, including Coronado Cupcakery (which we frequented), Il Fornaio, Candelas On the Bay, and Village Pizzeria, all of which were satisfying. A short drive to the ocean side of the island through charming houses lands you on a beautiful, wide beach (lifeguards included), with the stately Hotel del Coronado completing the picture. Great place to take kids - we and our two teenage boys loved the pool, restaurant, and all the hotel amenities. Room was very nice and spacious, with very nice bathroom, and balcony looking out on the pool area.
reviews.title: Coronado Island Marriott Hotel Stay

reviews.text: Enjoyed our two night stay at the hotel. The staff was friendly and answered all our questions. The beds were comfortable, but the pillows were a bit soft. The rooms and furnishings were good. We had a nice view over looking the pool and could see the water and boats from our balcony. We also ate at the hotel restaurant and thought the service and food were good.
reviews.title: Nice two night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful and wonderful resorts. We arrived on Saturday July 7th for a one night stay and arrived very early to the resort. Thanks Ilana! They quickly tried to accommodate an early check in and we used our points for the stay. One reviewer said you were not eligible for a bay view upgrade but they are wrong. It is a $29.00 charge and the best money you could spend. The parking is $22.00 for self park or $28.00 for valet. The self parking is underground and is super easy so I would suggest going with that option. The lobby and bar are spacious, with modern decor. We had a light lunch outside on the patio area. The Baja Fish Tacos were awesome but the rice and beans were bland. The fresh Margarita's were WONDERFUL! Not loaded down with sweet syrup mix...For dinner we walked to a beautiful restaurant nearby and had a romantic dinner. If you want to have a romantic weekend get a way this is the place to stay!!!
reviews.title: Loved Loved LOVED
